Subject: Cantera Compilation under AMD x86_64 with Sundials crashes
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=205845264; y=Q-s-e884riyKvdGta9cOWbixePuNBNX42b6KQ2Bc0hU7-Cx4Ew

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hello Friends
 
 In fact each day using and working with cantera I have many good surprises. I send my congratulations for David and thier colaborators for this nice code.
 
 I have some suggestions and need some help, too.
 
 First of all, I send my suggestions about how to configurate cantera to try to compile with Sundials suite from LLNL. Some modifications are necessary (up to crash as I show bellow) to compile it with SUNDIALS of LLNL. My machine is a AMD x86_64 with SUSE 10.0
 
 I installed the SUNDIALS suite version 2.2.0 at --prefix=/usr/local/share/sundials. I did need to modify mainly two things:
 
  a) Set the enviroment variable before to run configurate such as:
   % echo $CXXFLAGS
 -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/cvode -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/cvodes -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/ida -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/kinsol -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/sundials -L /usr/local/share/sundials/lib
  
  b) In the CVodesIntegrator.cpp, the include commands at line s 16 and 17 are replaced by:
 #include <sundials_types.h>
 #include <sundials_math.h>
 because the names are been replaced in Sundials file sets.
 
 But all these replacements and settings wasn't  enought to avoid the following errors during the cantera compilation (by make!):
 
 .
 .
 .
 g++ -c ODE_integrators.cpp -I. -I/usr/local/share/sundials/include -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/cvode -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/cvodes -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/ida -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/kinsol -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/sundials -L /usr/local/share/sundials/lib   
 In file included from CVodesIntegrator.cpp:8,
                  from ODE_integrators.cpp:5:
 CVodesIntegrator.h:26:21: error: nvector.h: No such file or directory
 In file included from ODE_integrators.cpp:5:
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:19:21: error: cvdense.h: No such file or directory
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:20:20: error: cvdiag.h: No such file or directory
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:21:21: error: cvspgmr.h: No such file or directory
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp: In destructor �€˜virtual Cantera::CVodesIntegrator::~CVodesIntegrator()�€™:
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:112: error: invalid conversion from �€˜void*�€™ to �€˜void**�€™
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:112: error:   initializing argument 1 of �€˜void CVodeFree(void**)�€™
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp: In member function �€˜void Cantera::CVodesIntegrator::sensInit(double, Cantera::FuncEval&)�€™:
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:198: error: �€˜N_VNewVectorArray_Serial�€™ was not declared in this scope
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp: In member function �€˜virtual void Cantera::CVodesIntegrator::initialize(double, Cantera::FuncEval&)�€™:
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:232: error: invalid conversion from �€˜void*�€™ to �€˜void**�€™
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:232: error:   initializing argument 1 of �€˜void CVodeFree(void**)�€™
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:240: error: invalid conversion from �€˜void (*)(realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, _generic_N_Vector*, void*)�€™ to �€˜int (*)(realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, _generic_N_Vector*, void*)�€™
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:240: error:   initializing argument 2 of �€˜int CVodeMalloc(void*, int (*)(realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, _generic_N_Vector*, void*), realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, int, realtype, void*)�€™
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:245: error: invalid conversion from �€˜void (*)(realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, _generic_N_Vector*, void*)�€™ to �€˜int (*)(realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, _generic_N_Vector*, void*)�€™
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:245: error:   initializing argument 2 of �€˜int CVodeMalloc(void*, int (*)(realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, _generic_N_Vector*, void*), realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, int, realtype, void*)�€™
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:261: error: �€˜CVDense�€™ was not declared in this scope
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:264: error: �€˜CVDiag�€™ was not declared in this scope
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:267: error: �€˜PREC_NONE�€™ was not declared in this scope
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:267: error: �€˜CVSpgmr�€™ was not declared in this scope
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp: In member function �€˜virtual void Cantera::CVodesIntegrator::reinitialize(double, Cantera::FuncEval&)�€™:
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:313: error: invalid conversion from �€˜void (*)(realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, _generic_N_Vector*, void*)�€™ to �€˜int (*)(realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, _generic_N_Vector*, void*)�€™
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:313: error:   initializing argument 2 of �€˜int CVodeReInit(void*, int (*)(realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, _generic_N_Vector*, void*), realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, int, realtype, void*)�€™
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:318: error: invalid conversion from �€˜void (*)(realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, _generic_N_Vector*, void*)�€™ to �€˜int (*)(realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, _generic_N_Vector*, void*)�€™
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:318: error:   initializing argument 2 of �€˜int CVodeReInit(void*, int (*)(realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, _generic_N_Vector*, void*), realtype, _generic_N_Vector*, int, realtype, void*)�€™
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:325: error: �€˜CVDense�€™ was not declared in this scope
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:328: error: �€˜CVDiag�€™ was not declared in this scope
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:331: error: �€˜PREC_NONE�€™ was not declared in this scope
 CVodesIntegrator.cpp:331: error: �€˜CVSpgmr�€™ was not declared in this scope
 make[1]: *** [ODE_integrators.o] Error 1
 make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/wladimyr/usr/src/cantera/cantera-CVS/Cantera/src'
 make: *** [kernel] Error 2
 =============================================
 
 The main changes in the configure file was
 
 --------------------
 #
 # USE_SUNDIALS='default'
 USE_SUNDIALS='y'
 SUNDIALS_HOME='/usr/local/share/sundials'
 -----------------------
 #
 BLAS_LAPACK_LIBS='-llapack -lblas'
 #'-llapack -lf77blas -lcblas -latlas'
 BLAS_LAPACK_DIR='/usr/lib64'
 ---------------------
 
 +++++++++
 
 I checked the files which the compilation error message claims (are not found) and it is not present in the sundials set.
 
 Can somebody help me to have succes to compile  cantera with sundials. I really would like to use cantera to reaction sensitivity analisys.  Have some examples about how to do it using cantera?
 
 Many tanks in advance
 
 Wladimyr

Hello Friends<br> <br> In fact each day using and working with cantera I have many good surprises. I send my congratulations for David and thier colaborators for this nice code.<br> <br> I have some suggestions and need some help, too.<br> <br> First of all, I send my suggestions about how to configurate cantera to try to compile with Sundials suite from LLNL. Some modifications are necessary (up to crash as I show bellow) to compile it with SUNDIALS of LLNL. My machine is a AMD x86_64 with SUSE 10.0<br> <br> I installed the SUNDIALS suite version 2.2.0 at --prefix=/usr/local/share/sundials. I did need to modify mainly two things:<br> <br>  a) Set the enviroment variable before to run configurate such as:<br>   % echo $CXXFLAGS<br> -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/cvode -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/cvodes -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/ida -I /usr/local/share/sundials/include/kinsol -I
